{{cpp/regex/sub_match/title|swap}}
{{cpp/regex/sub_match/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
void swap( sub_match&amp; s ) noexcept(/* see below */);
}}

Exchanges the contents of two sub-match objects. Equivalent to

{{c multi|
this-&gt;pair&lt;BidirIt, BidirIt&gt;::swap(s);|
std::swap(matched, s.matched);
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|s|a {{tt|sub_match}} to swap with}}
{{par hreq}}
{{par req named|BidirIt|LegacySwappable}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
{{noexcept|std::is_nothrow_swappable_v&lt;BidirIt&gt;}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;regex&gt;

int main()
{
    const char* s = "Quick red cat";
    std::sub_match&lt;const char*&gt; x, y;

    x.first = &amp;s[0];
    x.second = &amp;s[5];
    x.matched = false;

    y.first = &amp;s[012];
    y.second = &amp;s[13];
    y.matched = true;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Before swap:\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "x.str() = [" &lt;&lt; x.str() &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "y.str() = [" &lt;&lt; y.str() &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    assert(!x.matched and y.matched);

    x.swap(y);

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "After swap:\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "x.str() = [" &lt;&lt; x.str() &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "y.str() = [" &lt;&lt; y.str() &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    assert(x.matched and !y.matched);
}
|output=
Before swap:
x.str() = []
y.str() = [cat]
After swap:
x.str() = [cat]
y.str() = []
}}
